review:
Remember when "heroes never die" was such an iconic line in OW1? Well OW2 has no heroes alive with the direction it went: 

The downgrade from 6v6 made it less fun, sequel did not end up as PvE, new hero cinematics no longer have the same touch weaving together heroes as a story, battle pass just makes ppl have FOMO of cosmetics making the game centered on micro-transactions, and worst of all we no longer have our lord and savior, Jeff Kaplan.

I rather spend my time recommended by my friends playing FFXIV than this game using F2P business model to rack up moolah. While not a 1:1 comparison, at least FFXIV's free trial has more content/updates that values my time than this and doesn't have toxic teammates flexing their elo status. Spend ya money however you want, but spend it wisely. We deserved better, fellow gamers.

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.
